These treatments can be the difference between life and death, and I am proud that our new law fixes the problem and ensures access.
 https://www.floridadaily.com/gus-bilirakis-focuses-on-helping-patients-by-expanding-access-to-cell-transplants/ …

It will ensure patients in need of bone marrow or stem cell transplants have access to lifesaving treatment. For older Americans with blood cancers – like leukemia, lymphoma, and Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS), limited treatment options have been devastating.

ICYMI- As co-Chair of the Congressional Caucus to Cure Blood Cancers and Other Blood Disorders, I have been increasingly focused on cell transplant issues.  A bill I coauthored, the Patient Access to Cellular Transplant (PACT) Act was recently signed into law.

ICYMI- My bipartisan bill to help patients suffering with blood cancers was recently signed into law.  It was the 8th bill I co-authored to become law in 2019.  I look forward to continuing my work to put the needs of patients first when I return to Washington this week.

Particularly when it comes to doing the right thing for patients and for our nation’s heroes, I will continue to reach across the aisle and be the hardest working member of Congress to  get things done for my constituents!

I am proud of what we have accomplished, and appreciate being recognized in a Vanderbilt University study as being the most effective legislator in the State of Florida. I have always been a consensus builder, regardless of which party was in power or what distractions may exist.

My hope is that during this year, we will continue to make progress on legislation to ensure all Veterans have access to the care and benefits they have earned and deserve – a priority for Dr. Roe and me. (4/4)
Specifically, I am most proud of the MISSION Act, which ensures our heroes receive the best possible care, and the Forever GI Bill, which protects the educational benefits of Veterans for life. (3/4)

Dr. Roe is a true patriot and has been a wonderful friend to me as we endeavored to advocate for and improve the lives of our nation’s heroes.  I am proud of the monumental achievements we have made on behalf of Veterans with him at the helm of the VA Committee. (2/4)

While I am saddened to learn that my friend and long-time colleague will no longer be serving in the House after this term, I do wish him all the best in his well-deserved retirement.  https://roe.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=400690 … (1/4)
